bibl.note: This is a letter from Robert Scales to Andrew Crockett dated February 2, 1819. Scales informs Crockett that his hogshead of tobacco, which was a special casket used to store and transport tobacco, is ready to be attended to.

div1.p: Your Suspended Hogsd Tobc. was not prepared until my Boat was full, it is now ready for your disposal it will pass, I expect in the first class, you perhaps would do well to attend to as soon as convenient
I shall put off the day if nothing happens —

closer.add: Enclosd is your Order to Cooper & Maxey
